title: Smart wizard detection and tips
description:
Enhance ralph-config wizard to auto-detect environment and show helpful tips.

Auto-detect:
- Is bun installed? → suggest Ink UI
- Is gum installed? → note enhanced bash UI available
- Is this a monorepo? → detect apps from package.json workspaces
- Existing .zshrc RALPH_* vars → migrate them
- Tech stack from package.json (next, convex, supabase, etc.)

Tips:
- Show 'Run ralph-config anytime to change settings'
- If detection might be wrong, show how to override

acceptanceCriteria.text: Detect if bun is installed (command -v bun)
Detect if gum is installed (command -v gum)
Detect monorepo from package.json workspaces field
Detect tech stack from package.json dependencies
Check for existing RALPH_* vars in .zshrc
If bun installed: default runtime=bun, else runtime=bash
If monorepo: ask which app to configure, or all
Show what was detected before asking to confirm
After setup: 'Run ralph-config anytime to change settings'
If detection used: 'We detected X. Wrong? Run ralph-config --reset'
Show tip about --skip-setup flag for scripts
Test: Shows correct tips after setup
